title: Vodafone Launches M2M Platform
text:
21 September 2015 17:39 CET Vodafone Launches M2M Platform By Daily Guide 
Vodafone Ghana has officially launched its 'Machine to Machine' (M2M) service to improve the efficiency of companies in Ghana. 
According to Haris Broumidis, Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Vodafone Ghana, the telecommunication giant is seeking to leverage its global scale and expertise in technology to make Ghana's fast growing services sector more efficient. 
Vodafone's M2M platform, which is already operational in Ghana, is supported by a team of experts with responsibility for growing the M2M business countrywide. 
The team, which includes engineers, product and sales managers, is to ensure that customers' needs are met in a timely fashion. 
'Our reputation in this new technological frontier is unmatched across the world, and we are excited to be finally deploying it in Ghana. Vodafone views Ghana as a very important market for our continuous success as a company and M2M is one avenue to continue our success story. The world of work as we know it in Ghana will never be the same again,' Mr Broumidis stated. 
He added that the M2M platform covers the most crucial sectors of the economy including health, transport, logistics, banking, utilities and security where Vodafoneâ€™s SIM cards are used to smartly connect devices to enhance efficiency and productivity. 
'The focus is to deliver practical innovation to customers in Ghana and West Africa. We are now at the threshold of an era where humans and devices can co-exist on one network. In other words, everyday physical objects are connected to the internet and are able to identify themselves with other devices,' he said. 
Angela Mensah-Poku, Head of Vodafone Business Solutions (VBS), disclosed that the launch of the M2M platform would mark the beginning of a revolution in the business world that would help companies in Ghana become more result-oriented. 
'As a business committed to providing the best of service for our customers, we see M2M as a paradigm shift in making our customers even more comfortable with their activities,' she noted. 
She said the platform would provide customers with managed connectivity for smart service deployments.
